The critical phase of any DENV infection is the 24 to 48 hours surrounding defervescenceâ€”generally around days 5 to 7 of the febrile illness in a secondary DENV infection. This is the time period when plasma leakage will take place in patients developing DHF/DSS. A challenge in patients with dengue, or suspected dengue, is to identify those at risk for severe disease before the critical phase is reached. A group of warning signs and symptoms have been identified in DENV-infected patients that often presage the deterioration to DHF/DSS (severe dengue) (see Table 36.1.1).
18 These patients require close monitoring and supportive care during the critical phase of illness.
